intro: Kyllinga aurata, commonly known as golden dwarf sedge, is a herbaceous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant is characterized by its upright, grass-like stems and small, triangular leaves. Its flowers are clustered in spikelets, and the plant produces tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. Kyllinga aurata is often found in wetlands, marshes, and along the edges of water bodies, thriving in moist, well-drained soils.
